messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: We cannot know how street art will change. But some new things are happening now.

Most street artists are young. They paint in their city or area. But more artists now travel. They work in many places around the world.

Other artists use the internet. They talk to each other. They share photos of their art.

Also, the art world now sees street art. They think it is a real art form.

We do not know the future of street art. But we are sure it will stay.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS: The text successfully meets all CEFR A2 readability standards and accurately conveys the original meaning. All diagnostic checks were passed. The factual integrity is maintained, and both MeaningBERT (0.8395) and BERTScore (0.9282) are well above the required thresholds, indicating excellent preservation of meaning and lexical fidelity. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. The qualitative audit confirms appropriate vocabulary and simplified sentence structures. Complex grammatical constructions from the original, such as 'While' clauses, 'who' clauses, and 'that' clauses, have been effectively broken down into short, simple sentences using A2-level connectors like 'But' and 'Also'. Vocabulary has been consistently simplified to A1/A2 equivalents (e.g., 'develop' to 'change', 'neighbourhood' to 'area', 'legitimate' to 'real').

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: We cannot know how street art will change. But some new things are happening now.

Most street artists are young. They paint in their city or area. But more artists now travel. They work in many places around the world.

Other artists use the internet. They talk to each other. They share photos of their art.

Also, the art world now sees street art. They think it is a real art form.

We do not know the future of street art. But we are sure it will stay.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS: The text demonstrates excellent adherence to the CEFR A2 readability standard. All diagnostic checks were successfully passed. The factual integrity is maintained, with no discrepancies found between the original and simplified text. The MeaningBERT score of 0.8395 and BERTScore of 0.9282 both exceed the required thresholds, indicating strong preservation of meaning and lexical fidelity. The CEFR classifier accurately rated the text as A2. The vocabulary used is consistently at an A1/A2 level, with no unapproved B1 or B2 words detected. Sentence structures are short, simple, and appropriate for the A2 level, utilizing basic connectors like 'But' and 'Also' effectively. This is a model example of A2 simplification.
